intro: Exostema valenzuelae, commonly known as the Valenzuela's exostema, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink or white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
